pyzui.ppm module¶

Module for reading PPM images.

pyzui.ppm.read_ppm_header(f)[source]¶

Read the PPM header in the given file object f and return a tuple representing the dimensions of the image.

Raises IOError if the header is invalid and/or unsupported (must be ‘P6’ binary PPM format with maxval=255).

read_ppm_header(file) -> (long, long)

pyzui.ppm.enlarge_ppm_file(PPmFile, width, height, spacing)[source]¶
class pyzui.ppm.PPMTiler(infile, media_id=None, filext='jpg', tilesize=256)[source]¶

Bases: Tiler

PPMTiler objects are used for tiling PPM images.

Constructor: PPMTiler(string[, string[, string[, int]]])

Create a new Tiler for tiling the media given by media_id with the

image given by infile.

If media_id is omitted, it will be set to infile.

Tiles will be saved in the format indicated by filext and with the dimensions given by tilesize.

images are tiled with the following procedure: the number of tiles to cover a row of the image is calculated, the last tile of the row is of the minimum width to finish the image and standard height (256). the last row tiles are of the minimum heigh to finish the image and the last tile is of the minimum size to cover the bottom right corner of the image. The example below will have a self.numtiles_across_total = 2

t1 |t2

—-+–

t3 |t4
